meanings.definition: A sound made to express disapproval or contempt.
meanings.sent1: The audience let out a loud boo when the actor forgot his lines.
meanings.sent2: I heard a boo from the crowd when the referee made a bad call.
meanings.sent3: At the comedy show, the comedian pretended to boo himself for telling a bad joke.
meanings.sent4: The boo from the crowd felt like a cold wind of disapproval.
meanings.sent5: The boo echoed in the auditorium, leaving a sense of negativity in the air.

meanings.definition: A term of endearment used to refer to a romantic partner.
meanings.sent1: My boo surprised me with flowers on our anniversary.
meanings.sent2: I love spending time with my boo, watching movies and cuddling.
meanings.sent3: When my boo smiles, my heart feels warm and fuzzy.
meanings.sent4: She whispered 'goodnight, boo' before falling asleep in my arms.
meanings.sent5: Walking hand in hand with my boo makes me feel happy and loved.

meanings.sent1: The sudden noise in the dark alley managed to boo me.
meanings.sent2: I tried to boo my friend by jumping out from behind the door.
meanings.sent3: The cat likes to hide and boo me when I walk into the room.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected thunderstorm managed to boo the children playing outside.
meanings.sent5: The horror movie scene was so intense that it could boo anyone in the audience.

meanings.definition: To show disapproval or contempt towards someone.
meanings.sent1: She would always boo at the TV when her least favorite character appeared.
meanings.sent2: The fans started to boo loudly when the opposing team scored a goal.
meanings.sent3: I playfully booed my friend for wearing mismatched socks to the party.
meanings.sent4: The judge had to calm the courtroom when the spectators began to boo.
meanings.sent5: The audience's collective boo was a clear sign of their dissatisfaction with the performance.
